content.description: Climb the slab to the base of the headwall.  If you hug the left arete, it's 5.9.  If you stick to the face, it's more like 5.10b.  Pretty good rock.
content.location: At the far right end of the Slabtown area, this is the only route on the buttress to the right of Rattler.

content.description: More slab climbing through the horizontal line of pockets.  Good rock.
content.protection: 3 bolts, 1-2" gear, 2-bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: On the left end of Slabtown, this route is right of Centipede.  Start under the right side of the horizontal line of pockets.

content.description: Nice moves up vertical face.  Good rock on the route, choss above it.
content.location: Near the right end of the Slabtown area, this is the bolted line between the crack that is Mental Hygiene and the small cave near ground level.

content.description: Climb the slab beneath the left angling dihedral that becomes an undercling roof. Take advantage of pro before getting to the crack. Start working a hand traverse under the roof and navigate through loose, dirty rock eventually joining the anchors for Logan.
content.protection: SR. Lots of micro cams helped feel safe on this route but I used a lot of gear in general as some pro is questionable.
content.location: Slabtown between Logan and Lo and Behold.

content.description: Climb the face to the crack.  Climb the crack to its end, then traverse right ot the anchors on Rattler.  Pretty good rock.
content.protection: 3 bolts, 1 pin, gear to 2".  2-bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: Near the right end of the Slabtown area, this is the subtle, often-vegetated crack.  Start below it.

content.description: Steep slab climbing on good rock.
content.location: Near the left of the Slabtown area, this route is right of both Centipede and Soup.  Begin under the left end of the roof up high.

content.description: Great face climbing through bulges on good holds.
content.location: Near the middle of the Slabtown area, this route begins just right of the left-arching roof crack that is Raiders of the Chossed Arc.  This line splits the two small bulges.

content.description: More steep slab/face climbing on pretty good rock.
content.location: On the right end of the Slabtown area, just left of the broken vegetated crack that is Mental Hygiene.

content.description: Good steep slab/face climbing on mostly good rock.  The sling before the first bolt may be old, so bring your own.
content.protection: 4 bolts, a sling, 2-bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: Near the middle of the Slabtown area, this route is the steep slab/face right of Lo and Behold.  It usually has a sling through a hole before the first bolt.

content.description: Generic slab climbing through the horizontal line of pockets halfway up.  Good rock.
content.protection: 3 bolts, maybe a larger cam, 2-bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: At Slabtown, this is the leftmost route, the first one after coming down the main walkdown.  Start under the first bolt.

content.description: Slabby wall with pretty good rock.
